questions.explanation:
7. Have you made an appointment with your dentist yet?
(A) I'll put it upstairs for now. → Incorrect (unrelated to dentist appointment)
(B) Yes, last week. → Correct (confirms the appointment was made)
(C) A new supply order. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

8. Do you want to buy the blue sofa or the yellow one?
(A) A three-bedroom apartment. → Incorrect (unrelated to sofa choice)
(B) I like the yellow one. → Correct (specifies the preferred sofa)
(C) I've already been there. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

9. When is your restaurant going to open for business?
(A) These are new clothes. → Incorrect (unrelated to restaurant opening)
(B) By the end of the month. → Correct (specifies the opening time)
(C) Yes, it's a large rest area. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

10. Why won't my computer turn on?
(A) No, it's a small font. → Incorrect (unrelated to computer issue)
(B) Turn right at the corner. → Incorrect (refers to directions, not computer)
(C) Because the battery is old. → Correct (explains the computer issue)

11. Do you like the renovations we did to the office?
(A) The construction company down the street. → Incorrect (unrelated to opinion on renovations)
(B) He's in the cafeteria. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) Yes, it's very spacious now. → Correct (expresses opinion on renovations)

12. Which conference room is the accountant using?
(A) The one on the first floor. → Correct (specifies the conference room)
(B) It went well, thanks. → Incorrect (unrelated to the room)
(C) That was a lot of money. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

13. The Internet isn't working.
(A) There's the cleaning crew's checklist. → Incorrect (unrelated to Internet issue)
(B) We should call the IT department. → Correct (suggests a solution to the problem)
(C) Several copies, please. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

14. Would you like to present first, or should I?
(A) About twenty dollars each. → Incorrect (unrelated to presenting)
(B) No, it's the second train. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) I'm ready to start. → Correct (offers to present first)

15. The concert tickets are on sale now, aren't they?
(A) The new director of marketing. → Incorrect (unrelated to ticket sales)
(B) Yes, and they're selling fast. → Correct (confirms tickets are on sale)
(C) One of my favorite bands. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

16. Do you have any feedback about Yumiko's performance?
(A) Yes, her work is excellent. → Correct (provides feedback on performance)
(B) Near the back of the room. → Incorrect (unrelated to performance)
(C) It's nice to meet you. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

17. Why don't we reassign Silvia to the evening shift in the stockroom?
(A) Sure—I expect she'll be OK with that. → Correct (agrees to the reassignment)
(B) I sent my assignment to the instructor. → Incorrect (unrelated to shift reassignment)
(C) The new office furniture is comfortable. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

18. How can we find extra seasonal help?
(A) Spring is my favorite season. → Incorrect (unrelated to finding help)
(B) Let's post some job listings on our Web site. → Correct (suggests a method to find help)
(C) Because he left early today. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

19. Do you know if there's a bus from here to New York City?
(A) That's a great idea. → Incorrect (unrelated to bus information)
(B) No, he studied in London. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) Yes, there's one every day around nine o'clock. → Correct (provides bus information)

20. Who's driving you to the airport?
(A) The hotel has a free shuttle. → Correct (indicates the transportation method)
(B) She just received her pilot's license. → Incorrect (unrelated to driving)
(C) About twenty minutes late. → Incorrect (refers to time, not driver)

21. How often should I replace the water filter?
(A) A new coffeemaker. → Incorrect (unrelated to water filter)
(B) Can I have more ice, please? → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) There's a manual in the cabinet. → Correct (directs to information source)

22. Aren't you still on the event-planning committee?
(A) There's an orange sign at the entrance. → Incorrect (unrelated to committee status)
(B) Check the bookshelf by the window. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) Members are replaced every year. → Correct (explains committee status)

23. Would you like to join us for tea now in the cafeteria?
(A) I have a client meeting in ten minutes. → Correct (responds to the invitation)
(B) Actually, I joined a different gym. → Incorrect (unrelated to the tea invitation)
(C) Some tables and chairs. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

24. How do you think the new robotics technician is doing?
(A) I've been working off-site for a few weeks. → Correct (this answer)
(B) The tools are on my desk. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) Because the team won first place. → Incorrect (unrelated to performance)

25. I hope the building inspector will arrive soon.
(A) No, not as much as we expected. → Incorrect (unrelated to inspector’s arrival)
(B) Traffic is heavy on Highway 90. → Correct (explains possible delay in arrival)
(C) A multilevel apartment complex. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

26. We should order a cake for the company picnic.
(A) Some of the staff don't eat sweets. → Correct (raises a concern about the cake order)
(B) The bank is on Twelfth Street. → Incorrect (unrelated to the picnic)
(C) About five kilometers. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

27. Does the rental vehicle have automatic or manual transmission?
(A) It's on the shelf in the office. → Incorrect (unrelated to vehicle transmission)
(B) Bradley will be driving the vehicle. → Correct (refers to driver, this answer)
(C) The lights turn on automatically. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

28. I'd like to have some jackets altered.
(A) I prefer 100 percent cotton. → Incorrect (unrelated to altering jackets)
(B) When would you like to pick them up? → Correct (responds to the alteration request)
(C) Yes, it's a much shorter trip. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

29. Where should we unload the kitchen tiles?
(A) The client isn't at home right now. → Incorrect (unrelated to unloading location)
(B) Not long ago. → Incorrect (refers to time, not location)
(C) Sorry I spilled the water. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
Note: No correct answer provided; correct answer should be, e.g., 'In the storage room.'

30. Are you using the older version of the software or the one that was just released?
(A) I'm using brass hardware in the kitchen. → Incorrect (unrelated to software)
(B) Were we supposed to update the program? → Correct (addresses the software version)
(C) Yes, he has a used computer. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

31. Could you help me access my e-mail account before you leave?
(A) On the top shelf. → Incorrect (unrelated to e-mail access)
(B) Did you check the storage closet? → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) Several technicians are working late tonight. → Correct (does not confirm help)
